key_channel_insights.line_content: The OTA channel maintains consistent price parity or higher prices compared to Emirates' site, with a notable 58% higher pricing occurrence.
MSE predominantly offers lower prices than Emirates' site with 91.55% of flights priced lower last week.
GDS dominantly presents higher pricing in 64.3% of instances, with limited instances of offering lower prices at just 0.19%.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, there is no instance where OTA prices are lower than Emirates' site, maintaining a status of price parity or higher on the OTA channel.
OTA pricing is higher than Emirates in approximately 58% of cases, with a slight upward trend from the previous month.
The frequency of offering same prices compared to Emirates’ site is stable at around 38%. This reflects a consistent strategy in price alignment from OTAs.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: When Emirates’ website pricing is not found, the frequency is low and slightly declining at 3%, showing improved data alignment with OTAs.
Price matches stand stable at nearly 39% of instances, indicating strong parity in the market.

ota_summary_by_region.line_title: Short Haul Dominance in Higher Pricing
ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes show a higher discrepancy with 77% of prices exceeding Emirates’ site, although this is slightly tapering.

ota_summary_by_region.line_title: Long Haul Parity and Competitive Pricing
ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Long haul routes are closer to parity with about 53% same pricing and only 42% higher pricing compared to Emirates.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: From UAE origins, OTA prices are higher in about 58% and this trend is consistent over recent months.
Non-UAE points of origin align more frequently with Emirates pricing, showing competitive parity in over 41% of cases.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: In close-in booking windows, OTA prices are higher than Emirates in roughly 59% cases, increasing slightly over the month.
Far-out booking windows see stable pricing with OTAs showing competitive strategies, aligning closely with airline’s pricing in around 40% of cases.

mse_highlights.line_content: The majority of flights have lower prices on MSE, with 91.55% of offers undercutting the website's prices last week.
Instances where MSE prices are higher are minimal, with only 0.38% occurrences last week, slightly increased from the previous week.
Price parity, where MSE prices matched the airline's, saw a slight decrease by 0.21% compared to the preceding week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: A negligible rate of 0.19% last week indicates almost all flight offers are listed on MSE.
MSE continues to offer lower prices consistently, with a slight decrease of 0.18% in frequency compared to the previous week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul flights are predominantly cheaper on MSE, with 83.26% offering lower prices than the site prices last week.
For long haul flights, 98.58% offered lower prices on MSE, with minimal variance in frequency from the previous period.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating from AE maintain a high percentage of MSE lower prices at 98.72%, with minimal changes from prior data.
Non-AE origin flights have an 85.96% frequency of lower prices on MSE, with a notable 4.63% increase from the previous month.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Travelers booking close-in see better offers with 91.01% flights cheaper on MSE, slightly decreased from previous trends.
Far-out booking windows maintain consistent discounts, with 92.61% priced lower on MSE.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS shows a higher price 64.3% of the time on average, with only a slight decrease from previous reports.
Across all dimensions, prices are identical to the airline’s website in 16.3% of cases, showing a stable trend.
Instances where GDS offers a lower price are negligible at 0.19%, indicating limited competitive pricing on this channel.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Prices not available on GDS increased by 1.85% from pw to 19.2%. This signals potential missed opportunities.
Stable alignment, with minimal change, maintaining around 16% similarity with website prices.
GDS consistently higher, covering 64.3% in lw with minor recent decreases. This may impact competitiveness.
Instances of GDS offering lower prices remain extremely rare at 0.19%. This reiterates GDS’s premium pricing approach.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: GDS higher pricing on short haul consistently holds at roughly 60% with minimal change from previous.
GDS prices outpaced website 68.1% in lw, with a slight decrease signaling potential price corrections.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Prices missing from GDS increased to 8.4% in AE; growing trend suggests possible data gaps or restrictions.
Non-AE same pricing has slightly improved, but high GDS pricing still dominates at 65.5%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Price parity holds at 16.5% close-in, with GDS maintaining higher pricing at 65.5% in contrast to website.
GDS enjoys higher pricing at 62.5% far-out, but parity gains slightly at 15.9% indicating potential positioning opportunities.
